Title: Treasury Management Advice Services
Description:
Nottinghamshire County Council (the Council) has a requirement for Treasury Management Advice services. The Council does not currently have a contract for such services, having subscribed in the past to various market information systems as were appropriate for the management of a large in house equities portfolio, as part of the Council's Pension Fund. The in-house portfolio has now been pooled in accordance with Central Government requirements and these subscriptions are no longer cost effective and so the decision has been approved to procure a professional Treasury Management Advisor.

It should be noted that, apart from MS Excel, the Council currently uses no bespoke Treasury Management systems. In total, approximately 0.7 FTE staff are employed on Treasury Management activity by the Council.

The following is provided as further information 
•	Treasury Management Strategy 2019/20 - Appendix A
•	Treasury Management Policy 2019/20 - Appendix B
•	2017/18 Statement of Accounts - Appendix C
•	Summary of Investments and Debt as at 31st December 2018 - Appendix D
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Link Treasury Services Limited|65 Gresham Street, London, Greater London, EC2V 7NQ|NONE||No|No]

Title: Treasury Advisor Services
Description:
Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole Council (BCP) is a new unitary authority comprising from the merge of Bournemouth Borough Council, Christchurch Borough Council and the Borough of Poole for local government activities within Dorset.  This new authority requires a treasury management consultancy contract to provide advice to the new Authority from 1 April 2019. 
The Authority requires a single supplier to provide advice to provide the Council with guidance and advice on both short term and long term borrowing and investments. They will be required to provide regular reports and reviews as outlined below and notify the Council of any market changes that may affect the Council's investments or borrowings.
Additional Text:
Suppliers interested in this contract opportunity can access the full procurement documentation by visiting Bournemouth Borough Council's electronic Tendering system www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk

Suppliers should search for the contract opportunity through Supplying the South West. There are further details of the contract opportunity on the advert published on www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk and instructions on how suppliers can access the procurement documentation for completion. 

Responses to the contract opportunity must be submitted electronically through www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk before the deadline shown on the system. 

If you are unable to access the advert for the opportunity through www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk please contact the Council using the contact details provided.

Title: Treasury Management Advice
Description: South Lakeland District Council is inviting tenders for "Treasury Management Advice" covering:- Counterparty Credit Assessment; Investment Advice; Technical Advice; Debt Portfolio Management and Capital Financing; Year End Valuations of investments; Economic and Interest Rate Forecasting. The contract term is three years with an optional extension of up to two years. Please note: The total contract value is capped at £50k for the five year period. Bids received exceeding this value will be deemed to be non-compliant and excluded. All expressions of interest, submission and clarification questions must be submitted via the Chest (www.the-chest.org.uk.). Submission Deadline is 7pm on 10/ 11/17. Please note the Proactis Support line closes at 5.30pm, so should you encounter any problems after this time you will be unable to log them.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Link Treasury Services Limited|65 Gresham Street, London EC2V 7NQ|NONE||Yes|No]

Title: Provision of a Vehicle Lease Advisory Service (17-T08)
Description:
The East of England Ambulance Service NHS Trust wishes to create a framework of a single provider as a lease and procurement advisor in respect of the procurement, lease and maintenance management of Ambulance Service and Specialist vehicles and associated and other equipment requirements.

You are invited to submit offers for the provision of an advisory service including, but not limited to the procurement of vehicles, the arrangement of applicable lease facilities to support the purchase of those vehicles along with the maintenance management services as required.  The advisory service will include the portfolio management, ongoing and end of lease management and negotiation services.  Additional services including advise and support in respect of accountancy actions and reporting will also be required.
Additional Text: Access to this opportunity is via e-Tendering portal Bravo solutions.  Please follow the link shown and ensure you are registered with the portal to access the opportunity.  Enquiries relating to this tender should be made via the portal only
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Link Treasury Services Limited|65 Gresham Street, London, EC2V 7NQ|NONE||No|No]
